overview_of_class: This course will give emerging clinicians in CSD a solid foundation in theory, research, assessment, and intervention for individuals and families presenting with fluency concerns.  Students will integrate concepts within CSD for differential diagnosis in fluency.  Students will be able to describe fluency and its disorders using interdisciplinary frames of analysis which include cognitive, neurologic/neuromotor, genetic, psychosocial, linguistic, and developmental perspectives.  Students will be able to critically observe and analyze patterns of fluency/ disfluency and apply principles of stuttering intervention and counseling in experiential learning contexts.  Students will understand how to approach fluency issues across the lifespan as well as in intercultural service delivery contexts.
name: Fluency and Fluency Disorders
title: SoC CSD 494-0-1 Fluency and Fluency Disorders

subject: CSD
